title: Writing in Standard Form
text: We can divide both sides by $$-4$$ to put the equation in standard form. We now have $$\frac{-y}{4}=x^2$$
speech: We can divide both sides by  minus, 4  to put the equation in standard form. We now have , fraction, negative y, over 4,  is equal to x squared

title: Finding The Characteristics
text: From the equation, we can see that the vertex is $$(0,0)$$. Because we know that $$p=\frac{-1}{16}$$, we know that the focus is $$(0,\frac{-1}{16})$$ and the directrix is $$y=\frac{1}{16}$$
